item.description: The DPRK-linked Velvet Chollima APT group has launched a sophisticated cyberattack campaign targeting South Korean government officials, NGOs, government agencies, media organizations across multiple continents. The attack uses spear-phishing emails with weaponized PDF attachments and a novel social engineering tactic called "ClickFix" to trick users into running PowerShell commands as administrators.

item.title: Johnson Controls iSTAR Configuration Utility (ICU) Tool
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Johnson Controls Inc. iSTAR Configuration Utility (ICU) tool; CVE(s): CVE-2025-26383; Summary: The ICU tool leaks memory, which could result in unintended exposure of unauthorized data. Successful exploitation may allow an attacker to gain access to memory leaked from the ICU.

item.title: CISA Releases One Industrial Control Systems Advisory
item.description: CISA released one Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisory on May 27, 2025, providing timely information about current security issues and vulnerabilities surrounding ICS. The advisory is related to the Johnson Controls iSTAR Configuration Utility (ICU) Tool, but no further details are provided in this article.

item.title: New Guidance for SIEM and SOAR Implementation
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released new guidance for organizations on procuring and implementing Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) platforms. The guidance aims to help executives and practitioners enhance their organization's cybersecurity framework by improving visibility into network activities, detecting cyber threats quickly, and streamlining incident response processes.

item.title: Russian Hackers Breach 20+ NGOs Using Evilginx Phishing via Fake Microsoft Entra Pages
item.description: A Russia-affiliated threat actor known as Void Blizzard (aka Laundry Bear) has been attributed to "worldwide cloud abuse" since at least April 2024. The group targets organizations important to Russian government objectives, including those in government, defense, transportation, media, NGOs, and healthcare sectors in Europe and North America.

item.title: The Rise of Drive-By Downloads: How to Stay Protected
item.description: Drive-by downloads are a type of cyber attack that installs harmful software on a device without the user's knowledge or permission. The attack takes advantage of vulnerabilities within old browsers, plugins, or trusted sites and can install malware payloads quickly and silently.

item.title: Mozilla Quickly Fixes Firefox Vulnerabilities from Pwn2Own 2025 with Urgent Patches
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mozilla Firefox; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4918, CVE-2025-4919; Summary: Two zero-day exploits were demonstrated against Mozilla Firefox's content process at Pwn2OwnBerlin, targeting the browser's JavaScript engine. The vulnerabilities allowed out-of-bounds memory access and raised the risk of remote code execution and sensitive data exposure. However, neither exploit succeeded in escaping Firefox's sandbox, a critical security boundary designed to prevent attackers from gaining full control over the user's system.

item.title: Russian Void Blizzard cyberspies linked to Dutch police breach
item.description: The article discusses a Russian-backed cyberespionage group, Void Blizzard, which has been linked to a September 2024 Dutch police security breach. The attackers stole work-related contact information of multiple officers using a pass-the-cookie attack and infostealer malware.

item.title: AI Agents and the Non‑Human Identity Crisis: How to Deploy AI More Securely at Scale
item.description: The article discusses the risks associated with the increasing use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in enterprise environments. Non-human identities (NHIs), such as machine identities, service accounts, and AI agents, are overwhelming corporate clouds, making it difficult to manage secrets effectively. The article highlights five actionable controls to reduce AI-related NHI risk: auditing and cleaning up data sources, centralizing NHI management, preventing secrets leaks in LLM deployments, improving logging security, and restricting AI data access.

item.title: Adidas Customer Information Compromised Through Third-Party Vendor
item.description: A third-party customer service provider of Adidas was compromised by cybercriminals, exposing contact information of customers who interacted with the help desk. The breach did not involve sensitive information such as passwords or payment details, but may have exposed names, email addresses, phone numbers, and possibly home addresses and birthdates.

item.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in Hardy Barth EV Station Allow Unauthenticated Network Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hardy Barth eCharge Hardy Barth cPH2 and cPP2 charging stations; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27803, CVE-2025-27804, CVE-2025-48413, CVE-2025-48414, CVE-2025-48415, CVE-2025-48416, CVE-2025-48417; Summary: The eCharge Hardy Barth cPH2 and cPP2 charging stations have been found to have several critical security flaws, including missing authentication, OS command injection, hard-coded OS backdoor user, undocumented web interface credentials, USB backdoor, SSH backdoor, and hard-coded TLS certificates. These vulnerabilities can be exploited to compromise the system, exfiltrate sensitive data, disrupt charging operations, and launch man-in-the-middle attacks.

item.title: Silver RAT Malware Employs New Anti-Virus Bypass Techniques to Execute Malicious Activities
item.description: The article discusses a newly identified malware strain called Silver RAT, which is a remote access trojan (RAT) that leverages anti-virus bypass techniques to evade detection and compromise Windows-based systems. It uses process hollowing, dynamic API resolution, and obfuscated code execution to remain undetected, making it difficult for security tools to detect its behavior.

item.title: Researchers Uncover macOS ‘AppleProcessHub’ Stealer: TTPs and C2 Server Details Revealed
item.description: AppleProcessHub malware has been identified as an information-stealing malware designed to infiltrate Apple systems and exfiltrate sensitive user data. The malware employs advanced tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) to evade detection and establish persistent communication with command-and-control (C2) servers.

item.title: GIMP Image Editor Vulnerability Allows Remote Attackers to Execute Arbitrary Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GIMP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2760, CVE-2025-2761; Summary: Two high-severity vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-2760 and CVE-2025-2761) were discovered in GIMP image editing software, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code with user privileges. The vulnerabilities impact users who open malicious image files or visit compromised websites, and can lead to remote code execution, data exposure, malware installation, or persistent system compromise.

item.title: Employees Searching Payroll Portals on Google Tricked Into Sending Paychecks to Hackers
item.description: Threat hunters have exposed a novel campaign that uses search engine optimization (SEO) poisoning techniques to target employee mobile devices and facilitate payroll fraud. The attackers use fake login pages to access the employee payroll portal and redirect paychecks into accounts under their control, exploiting weaknesses in home office routers and mobile networks to mask their traffic.

item.title: Windows Server emergency update fixes Hyper-V VM freezes, restart issues
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses an emergency update from Microsoft to address a known issue causing some Hyper-V virtual machines with Windows Server 2022 to freeze or restart unexpectedly, mainly affecting Azure confidential VMs. The issue is fixed by the KB5061906 cumulative update for Windows Server 2022.

item.title: Red Hat and AMD Team Up to Boost AI Processing Power and Performance
item.description: This article is about a strategic collaboration between Red Hat and AMD to revolutionize artificial intelligence (AI) workloads. The partnership aims to simplify access to validated GPU Operators for enterprise users by integrating AMD Instinct GPUs within Red Hat OpenShift AI, a Kubernetes-based platform for building and scaling AI/ML models.

item.title: New Android Malware GhostSpy Grants Attackers Full Control Over Infected Devices
item.description: GhostSpy is a high-risk Android malware that employs advanced evasion, persistence, and surveillance techniques to seize control over infected devices. It has capabilities such as keylogging, bypassing banking app protections, screen capture, audio/video recording, GPS tracking, SMS interception, and unauthorized financial transactions.

item.title: Adidas warns of data breach after customer service provider hack
item.description: Adidas disclosed a data breach where an unauthorized party hacked a third-party customer service provider and stole some customers' data. The stolen information did not include payment-related information or passwords, but only contact information.

item.title: Siemens SiPass Flaw Allows Remote Attackers to Cause DoS Conditions
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SiPass integrated; CVE(s): CVE-2022-31812; Summary: A critical out-of-bounds read vulnerability (CVE-2022-31812) affects all SiPass integrated versions before V2.95.3.18, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to trigger a denial of service condition and disrupting access control operations for organizations relying on SiPass for physical security management.

item.title: Arm Mali GPU Vulnerability Enables Bypass of MTE and Arbitrary Kernel Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Arm Mali GPU driver; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0072; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the Arm Mali GPU driver (CVE-2025-0072) allows a malicious Android app to bypass the Memory Tagging Extension (MTE) and achieve arbitrary kernel code execution. The exploit manipulates queue->phys fields to point to newly allocated GPU memory pages while maintaining user-space mappings to previously freed pages, creating a use-after-free scenario.

item.title: Hackers Exploit HTTP/2 Flaw to Launch Arbitrary Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple web infrastructure products; CVE(s): None; Summary: A study by Tsinghua University and Zhongguancun Laboratory has discovered critical vulnerabilities in modern web infrastructure related to HTTP/2 serverpush and Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG) features. These vulnerabilities can be exploited to bypass the Same-Origin Policy, allowing attackers to push malicious resources that are treated as legitimate by the browser.

item.title: Hackers Are Calling Your Office: FBI Alerts Law Firms to Luna Moth’s Stealth Phishing Campaign
item.description: The FBI has warned of social engineering attacks by criminal extortion actor Luna Moth targeting law firms over two years, using IT-themed calls and callback phishing emails to gain remote access to systems or steal sensitive data. The attackers have shifted tactics, now posing as employees from the company's IT department to gain access to devices.

item.title: Critical GitHub MCP Server Vulnerability Allows Unauthorized Access to Private Repositories
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GitHub MCP integration; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the GitHub MCP integration allows attackers to manipulate a user's agent via a malicious GitHub Issue, coercing it into leaking sensitive information from private repositories. The exploit occurs when an attacker crafts a malicious issue in a user's public repository, embedding a prompt injection payload that triggers a toxic agent flow and exposes private data through autonomously created pull requests.

item.title: Russia-Linked Hackers Target Tajikistan Government with Weaponized Word Documents
item.description: This article describes a spear-phishing campaign conducted by the Russia-aligned threat actor TAG-110 targeting Tajikistan using macro-enabled Word templates as an initial payload. The attack chain is a departure from the threat actor's previously documented use of an HTML Application (.HTA) loader dubbed HATVIBE, and the goal is likely to gather intelligence for influencing regional politics or security.

item.title: How Google Meet Pages Are Exploited to Deliver PowerShell Malware
item.description: A new wave of cyberattacks, dubbed ClickFix, exploits user trust in Google Meet by deploying fake meeting pages that trick victims into running malicious PowerShell commands. The attack bypasses traditional security measures and targets Windows and macOS systems, ultimately leading to the download and execution of a remote access trojan (RAT).

item.title: Meteobridge Web Interface Vulnerability Let Attackers Inject Commands Remotely
item.description: Vulnerable Product: MeteoBridge; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4008; Summary: The MeteoBridge firmware has a severe command injection vulnerability (CVE-2025-4008) in versions 6.1 and below, allowing remote, unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges. The vulnerability resides in the CGI shell script accessible at /cgi-bin/template.cgi, which processes user input without proper sanitization, making it vulnerable to command injection attacks.

item.title: Hackers Reportedly Selling Over 500 Stolen Crypto Databases on Dark-Web Forums
item.description: A threat actor is allegedly selling a ZIP archive containing over 500 compromised databases related to cryptocurrency platforms. The leaked data reportedly includes user information, wallet details, balances, transaction histories, and email addresses connected to the accounts. This breach highlights the need for enhanced security measures in the crypto industry.

item.title: ChatGPT Deep Research Now Integrates with Dropbox and OneDrive to Retrieve Data
item.description: The article discusses the beta feature "Deep Research Connectors" in ChatGPT, which allows users to access and analyze live data from third-party applications such as Dropbox, Microsoft OneDrive, GitHub, Microsoft SharePoint, and Box directly within ChatGPT's interface. This integration aims to streamline workflows by embedding search and analysis functionalities into a single platform, while adhering to strict privacy protocols and offering varying levels of access based on subscription plans.

item.title: FBI Issues on Silent Ransom Group Using Fake IT Support Calls to Target Victims
item.description: The Silent Ransom Group (SRG) has shifted its tactics to impersonate IT department employees through unsolicited phone calls to trick individuals into granting remote access to their systems. SRG targets organizations across multiple sectors, including medical and insurance industries, using socially engineered phishing schemes to install remote access software and steal sensitive information.

item.title: Fake DigiYatra Apps Target Indian Users to Steal Financial Data
item.description: Threat actors have been exploiting India's digital public infrastructure by setting up a deceptive phishing site, digiyatra[.]in, impersonating the DigiYatra Foundation. The site is designed to harvest personal user data and has been flagged by ThreatWatch360 as a potential threat to unauthorized data collection, public deception, and reputational damage.

item.title: Katz Stealer Targets Chrome, Edge, Brave, and Firefox to Steal Login Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Katz Stealer; CVE(s): None; Summary: Katz Stealer is a credential-stealing malware-as-a-service that targets popular web browsers, cryptocurrency wallets, communication platforms, email clients, and gaming platforms. It conducts extensive system reconnaissance and data theft by extracting saved passwords, cookies, and session tokens, and employs advanced evasion mechanisms to avoid detection.

item.title: 60 Malicious npm Packages Exfiltrate Hostnames, IP Addresses, and DNS Server Details
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple malicious packages in the npm registry; CVE(s): None; Summary: A threat actor has published 60 malicious packages in the npm registry, which embed a covert script that gathers sensitive system data during the npm install process. The harvested data is exfiltrated to a Discord webhook, enabling real-time tracking of infected systems across Windows, macOS, and Linux environments.

item.title: Threat Actors Deploy Database Client Tools on Targeted Systems to Exfiltrate Sensitive Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various; CVE(s): None; Summary: Cybersecurity experts have observed an increase in data breaches where threat actors are using legitimate database client tools such as DBeaver, Navicat, and sqlcmd to steal sensitive information. These tools, often used by administrators for database management, blend into normal system operations, making detection challenging.

item.title: Over 70 Malicious npm and VS Code Packages Found Stealing Data and Crypto
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: npm packages; CVE(s): None; Summary: As many as 60 malicious npm packages have been discovered, including 20 packages under three different accounts. The packages install with an executable script that targets Windows, macOS, or Linux systems and includes basic sandbox-evasion checks. The harvested information is transmitted to a Discord webhook, enabling a threat actor to chart the network and identify high-value targets.
FYSA: Threat actors have been discovered abusing open-source repositories for malware distribution, including malicious npm packages, Microsoft's Visual Studio Code (VS Code) Marketplace, and GitHub. The threats include supply chain attacks at scale, phishing campaigns, and cryptocurrency wallet credential theft.

item.title: SharpSuccessor PoC Released to Weaponize Windows Server 2025 BadSuccessor Flaw
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows Server 2025; CVE(s): CVE-2025-XXXX; Summary: A privilege escalation vulnerability in the delegated Managed Service Account (dMSA) feature allows attackers to compromise Active Directory domains using tools like SharpSuccessor. The attack chain exploits default configurations and improper validation of the msDS-ManagedAccountPrecededByLink attribute during dMSA migration, enabling attackers to create a malicious dMSA object, manipulate Kerberos tickets, and gain Domain Admin privileges.

item.title: Oracle TNS Flaw Exposes System Memory to Unauthorized Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Oracle; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30733; Summary: The vulnerability allows unauthenticated remote attackers to access sensitive system memory, including environment variables and connection data, by exploiting a memory leak in the Oracle Database Server's RDBMS Listener. The flaw affects Oracle Database Server versions 19.3–19.26, 21.3–21.17, and 23.4–23.7, with a CVSS 3.1 Base Score of 6.5, indicating a medium severity risk.

item.title: Google claims users find ads in AI search 'helpful'
item.description: The article discusses Google's introduction of ads in their AI mode and AI Overviews, claiming that users find them helpful. However, critics argue that ads can be misleading or disrupt the flow of content.

item.title: OpenAI plans to ship an interesting ChatGPT product by 2026
item.description: OpenAI is planning to release a new product by 2026 that combines their ChatGPT technology with hardware, allowing users to use AI natively. This could potentially expand the reach of AI-powered services beyond just apps and websites.
